Job Position: Procurement Personnel
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Procurement Personnel to manage the purchasing of goods and services for the hotel.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for sourcing reliable suppliers, negotiating contracts, ensuring timely delivery, and maintaining accurate procurement records.
	This role is crucial to ensuring the smooth operation of hotel departments by providing quality supplies at the best value.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and source reliable suppliers for food, beverages, equipment, linens, cleaning materials, and other hotel supplies.
	Negotiate contracts, prices, and terms of purchase to achieve cost savings without compromising quality.
	Prepare purchase orders and ensure timely delivery of goods and services.
	Maintain accurate procurement records, supplier databases, and inventory reports.
	Work closely with department heads (kitchen, housekeeping, front office, etc.) to forecast and fulfill supply needs.
	Monitor stock levels to avoid shortages or overstocking.
	Inspect delivered goods for quality, accuracy, and compliance with hotel standards.
	Ensure all procurement activities comply with the hotel&rsquo;s financial and operational policies.
	Report on market trends, supplier performance, and procurement challenges to management.


Method of Application&nbsp;

Procurement Personnel Job at Greywood Hotels & Apartments




        
    

        
        Greywood Hotels & Apartments is situated in a serene and well-secured environment. We pride ourselves in providing clean and comfortable accomodation to all our guests which includes work professionals, corporate entities etc. If perfect relexationis your desire, Greywood Hotels & Apartments is definitely the ideal place to be.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Personnel
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Procurement Personnel to manage the purchasing of goods and services for the hotel.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for sourcing reliable suppliers, negotiating contracts, ensuring timely delivery, and maintaining accurate procurement records.
	This role is crucial to ensuring the smooth operation of hotel departments by providing quality supplies at the best value.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and source reliable suppliers for food, beverages, equipment, linens, cleaning materials, and other hotel supplies.
	Negotiate contracts, prices, and terms of purchase to achieve cost savings without compromising quality.
	Prepare purchase orders and ensure timely delivery of goods and services.
	Maintain accurate procurement records, supplier databases, and inventory reports.
	Work closely with department heads (kitchen, housekeeping, front office, etc.) to forecast and fulfill supply needs.
	Monitor stock levels to avoid shortages or overstocking.
	Inspect delivered goods for quality, accuracy, and compliance with hotel standards.
	Ensure all procurement activities comply with the hotel’s financial and operational policies.
	Report on market trends, supplier performance, and procurement challenges to management.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: greywoodjobs@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Hotel Cashier",
  "description": "Bolton White Group is a group of hospitality brands providing exceptional services across all our business units. Our team is dedicated to providing a wide range of clients with world-class services. Bolton White Group is well regarded for its focus on international best practices in all aspects of its business.

Bolton White Group is an independent entrepreneurial-driven institution offering a complete range of hospitality services with a focus on providing a &lsquo;home away from home&rsquo; experience to our clients. By choosing to join Bolton White Group you have assumed your share of the responsibility for maintaining the high principles and standards to which we are dedicated.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Hotel Cashier

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Handle guest check-ins/check-outs, billing, and payment transactions accurately.
	Process cash, credit card, debit card, and other payment methods in compliance with hotel policies.
	Issue receipts, invoices, and refunds when necessary.
	Maintain accurate cash drawers and reconcile transactions at the beginning and end of shifts.
	Assist in preparing daily cashier reports, deposits, and financial records.
	Respond to guest inquiries about charges, payments, and billing issues.
	Support front office and F&amp;B teams in handling guest accounts and room charges.
	Follow internal control procedures to prevent fraud and ensure compliance with financial standards.
	Maintain the confidentiality of guest and financial information.
	Provide courteous and professional service to all guests.


Qualifications &amp; Skills


	Minimum of a B.Sc.in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or a related field with 1-3 years of experience
	Previous experience as a cashier, teller, or in a finance role; hospitality experience preferred.
	Strong numerical and analytical skills.
	Proficiency in using POS systems, hotel management software (e.g., Opera, Micros), and MS Office.
	Excellent communication and customer service skills.
	High level of integrity, accuracy, and attention to detail.
	Ability to work flexible shifts, weekends, and holidays.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Photograph to:&nbsp;jobs@boltonwhitegroup.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Hotel Cashier Job at Bolton White Group




        
    

        
        Bolton White Group is a group of hospitality brands providing exceptional services across all our business units. Our team is dedicated to providing a wide range of clients with world-class services. Bolton White Group is well regarded for its focus on international best practices in all aspects of its business.

Bolton White Group is an independent entrepreneurial-driven institution offering a complete range of hospitality services with a focus on providing a ‘home away from home’ experience to our clients. By choosing to join Bolton White Group you have assumed your share of the responsibility for maintaining the high principles and standards to which we are dedicated.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Hotel Cashier

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Handle guest check-ins/check-outs, billing, and payment transactions accurately.
	Process cash, credit card, debit card, and other payment methods in compliance with hotel policies.
	Issue receipts, invoices, and refunds when necessary.
	Maintain accurate cash drawers and reconcile transactions at the beginning and end of shifts.
	Assist in preparing daily cashier reports, deposits, and financial records.
	Respond to guest inquiries about charges, payments, and billing issues.
	Support front office and F&B teams in handling guest accounts and room charges.
	Follow internal control procedures to prevent fraud and ensure compliance with financial standards.
	Maintain the confidentiality of guest and financial information.
	Provide courteous and professional service to all guests.


Qualifications & Skills


	Minimum of a B.Sc.in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or a related field with 1-3 years of experience
	Previous experience as a cashier, teller, or in a finance role; hospitality experience preferred.
	Strong numerical and analytical skills.
	Proficiency in using POS systems, hotel management software (e.g., Opera, Micros), and MS Office.
	Excellent communication and customer service skills.
	High level of integrity, accuracy, and attention to detail.
	Ability to work flexible shifts, weekends, and holidays.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Photograph to: jobs@boltonwhitegroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
